title: As it happened: Tim Peake's first spacewalk - BBC News
summary: british astronaut tim peake completed his first spacewalk at 17:31 gmt on friday 15 january after nearly five hours in space .
intended to be longer than six hours , the walk was cut short after his us colleague tim kopra reported water in his helmet .
the duo successfully completed their main job , replacing a faulty unit that regulates power from the station 's solar panels .
other scheduled work , including routing many metres of cables for new docking ports , was left for future spacewalks .
major tim is currently on a six-month mission to the space station for the european space agency .

documents.title: goodbye from us
text: that concludes our live coverage of today 's spacewalk - the first for british astronaut tim peake .
thank you for reading , watching and contributing !
read more on the bbc news website :
tim peake spacewalk ends early
tim peake 's parents 'thrilled ' at spacewalk
and tune in to bbc two at 21:00 gmt tonight to see stargazing live : the spacewalk

documents.title: the moment the spacewalk was called off
text: this is the moment today 's spacewalk was cut short , due to a water bubble in tim kopra 's helmet .
it was just before 17:00 gmt - four hours and 10 minutes into the space walk .
guys , you can start opening your cuff checklists to page seven ; we are in a terminate case .

documents.title: checks underway on spacesuits
text: mission controllers are gathering evidence on what might have caused the bubble of water inside tim kopra 's helmet .
station commander scott kelly is helping the astronauts inside the equipment room of the iss .
tim kopra 's suit and helmet will be carefully analysed .
the temperature of the water is one clue - cold water suggests it came from some sort of leak inside the space suit , rather than sweat or condensation .

documents.title: recap : highlights of tim peake 's spacewalk
text: watch highlights of the two tims ' first task , repairing a solar power unit .

documents.title: send us your views : 'magical moment'bbc science news on facebook

my class came back in at lunchtime to continue watching it , so that they did n't miss the moment history was made !
a once in a lifetime awe-inspiring magical moment !
and this from brian brian , earlier today :
it 's amazing how they 're going over 17,000mph and it just looks like they 're just drifting .

documents.title: astronauts safely back inside
text: both tim peake and tim kopra are inside the space station , in the equipment room , with their helmets removed .
`` all 's well that ends well , '' said mission commentator rob navias .
he said it was a `` safe and successful end '' to the spacewalk , if a bit early .
meanwhile , italian astronaut luca parmitano - who also suffered a water leak in his helmet on a spacewalk in 2013 - has tweeted his congratulations .

documents.title: careful process of de-suiting and keeping evidence
text: the inner door of the airlock is now open .
back inside the space station , tim kopra is being assisted out of his suit .
there is no live tv coverage at the moment , but we can hear instructions being issued - including a request to collect some of the troublesome water with a syringe for later analysis .

i feel so privileged - and a bit emotional !

documents.title: astronauts thank ground control for `` dedication and hard work ''
text: both tim kopra and tim peake voiced their thanks to the mission controllers as they waited for the pressure in the airlock to equalise .
although not all the jobs on the list were completed , the two tims did manage to restore full power to the iss when they replaced the `` sequential shunt unit '' just before 15:00 gmt .

documents.title: breakingspacewalk officially ends at 17:31 gmt
text: the airlock is being repressurised now , which denotes the official end of the spacewalk , according to nasa - after four hours and 43 minutes .

documents.title: astronauts prepare to go back inside iss
text: the two tims , safely inside the airlock , are now running through checks and closing the hatch behind them .
their colleagues on the space station are waiting on the other side of the inner door , to help them out of their space suits .

documents.title: not the first experience of a water leak in a spacesuit
text: space controllers are taking no chances after an incident in 2013 when italian astronaut luca parmitano discovered his helmet was starting to fill with water during a spacewalk .
his ventilation system had sprung a leak .
liquid does n't flow under microgravity , so the water sat in his helmet , forcing him to cut short his spacewalk .
`` i started going back to the airlock and the water kept trickling , '' parmitano has said .
`` it completely covered my eyes and my nose .
it was really hard to see .
i could n't hear anything .
it was really hard to communicate .
`` i could n't breathe through my nose - i felt isolated and when i tried to tell ground that i was having trouble finding my way , they could n't hear me , and i could n't hear them either .
`` instead of focussing on the problem - which was i may drown with the next gulp of air - i started thinking about solutions . ''
parmitano gradually felt his way back to the airlock and made it safely back inside .
author: Helen Briggs
BBC News

documents.title: steady progress wrapping up the spacewalk
text: after the decision to end the spacewalk early , mission controllers are watching closely in houston as the crew heads back to the airlock .
nasa says the astronauts are `` not in any danger whatsoever '' .

documents.title: send us your comments : the weekend starts hereemail : haveyoursay @ bbc.co.uk
text: incredible .
enjoying an end of week pint in my 'local ' .
watching tim peake 's spacewalk on my smartphone , thinking how we often take technology for granted .
it all seems so far away from the neil armstrong days , yet space has n't changed .

documents.title: get in touch : tim peake 'a real hero'email : haveyoursay @ bbc.co.uk
text: another contribution to the soundtrack discussion
it has to be david bowie but perhaps not the obvious choices of starman , life on mars or space oddity .
my choice would be heroes as tim peake is a real hero , .
or let 's dance because of the beautiful choreography of weightlessness .

documents.title: astronauts head back to airlock
text: the two astronauts were more than four hours into the planned six-and-a-half hour spacewalk when the problem happened .
nasa says tim kopra reported a small water bubble in his helmet and with the essential work completed the decision was made to terminate .
nasa says the crew are not in any danger but are being told to return to the station as a precaution .

documents.title: breakingspace walk to be ended
text: the space walk is being terminated after tim kopra reported a small amount of water in his helmet .

documents.title: send us your comments : stars are comparatively faintemail : haveyoursay @ bbc.co.uk
text: a response to gary burrows ' question , below
the reason no stars are ever seen in space walks is due to how dim they are compared to the other objects in view of the camera .
if the camera panned around to show nothing but the blackness of space , the camera 's exposure could be easily adjusted to see the stars .
as it is , the earth , the iss , and the astronauts are all much much brighter than the stars and the camera 's exposure is adjusted accordingly .
if you increased the exposure so that the stars could be seen , the view on your tv screen would be so bright you would n't be able to make out anything at all - you 'd be blinded !

documents.title: routing cables for the next generation of spaceflight
text: the cables tim peake is putting into place will support a unit called the international docking adaptor .
tim peake 's cabling task is for the ida , which will be where future commercial crew vehicles will dock .
@ twitterid hey tim !
when you look long into the abyss , say hi for me !

documents.title: get involved : perfect spacewalk soundtrack ? email : haveyoursay @ bbc.co.uk
text: i 'm watching this and listening to hunky dory by david bowie - the perfect soundtrack for tim 's spacewalk .

documents.title: astronauts to split up and work on separate tasks
text: the two tims will now move apart and work on different sections of the space station .
before they moved away from the airlock , astronaut reid wiseman at mission control asked how they were feeling .
`` i 'm feeling good , '' said tim kopra , who is assigned the identifier `` ev1 '' .
`` ev2 's doing good , '' added tim peake .

documents.title: send us your comments : `` i ca n't look away ''
text: carol eyden on our facebook page :
i have n't taken my eyes off [ the spacewalk ] since it started .
even when i was making a bread and butter pudding my laptop was on the draining board the nasa footage is great , thank you !

documents.title: faulty unit safely stowed back in the airlock
text: `` i 've placed the failed ssu unit back in the airlock , '' said tim peake .
`` everything is looking great , '' said mission control , as tim kopra continued to work and tim peake was asked to `` hang out '' and wait for further instructions .

documents.title: spectacular view of tim peake traversing the space station
text: the two tims are stowing some equipment back in the airlock , before they continue with today 's jobs .
an external camera on the space station captured this shot as tim peake made the careful journey back towards the airlock .

documents.title: spacewalk continues - ahead of schedule
text: the astronauts are continuing with their tasks , and their prompt work with the sequential shunt unit has put them ahead of the timetable .
`` the ssu is performing as expected , with the sun up , '' the two tims were told by mission control .
meanwhile , the brief discussion about a carbon dioxide ( co2 ) reading from tim kopra 's suit was `` no cause for alarm '' according to the european space agency :
@ astro tim reporting a bad co2 sensor but no cause for alarm , the suit is still fine and the # spacewalk continues
@ twitterid @ twitterid good good

text: the replacement sequential shunt unit is installed and is being checked out back on earth .
